Posts.Content: worried2298 wrote: I am 34. I found a lump 4 months ago. But its not ncessarily a lump per say. It feels like a tissue mass. It feels the same as other side, just thicker and more raised. Its hard to find laying down but when standing up without a bra i can feel it. Its on the outer quadrant..feels like tissue. It does get harder around my period and more noticeable. But it never fully goes away. Had a mammo and ultrasound two months ago. They saw a few tiny cysts but the tissue mass didnt show up at all. The ultrasound took 30 minutes. Tech did it and then radiologist cane in and did it. He said that it was just alot of denser tissue and that it is probably just how im built. They found absolutley nothing. I am going to see a breast specialist tomorrow and am terrified. I made the appointment because i felt unsattisfied. Can anyone give advice. Has anyone felt a similar type lump that wasnt cancer? Can a fibroadenoma not show up on tests? I dont want to be afraid. Has anyone had this happen and results turned out ok? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: tissue mass..neg ultrasound and mammo worried2298 CUGymGirl

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2014 07:28PM worried2298 wrote: because i feel a mass and they say its nothing. And i was trying to figure out why it didnt show up..and then i read stories of many who went through that and it was cancer. It wasnt trying to scare myself.
Posts.Title: tissue mass..neg ultrasound and mammo worried2298 CUGymGirl

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2014 08:19AM worried2298 wrote: is it normal for a tissue mass from fibrocystic breasts to always be there. Also...i guess i just get nervous because i read all these threads of people who had cancer but it didnt show up on their tests. I guess i wonder how the tissue mass doesnt show up at all. Sorry..just scared. Thank u so much for your info though. Its more info then i got from my own research.

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2014 06:00PM worried2298 wrote: Hearts pounding..anxiety setting in. Looking at my 16 year old daughter wondering how i would tell her if i end up having cancer. Half regretting asking for a second opinion on my negative results. Knowing most posts on here are from breast cancer patients and not people who ended up being ok...should make me feel better but it doesnt. Life is so scary...i wish i could just be reassured.
